title: How a 6-foot-4 guard became one of the most feared defenders in the NBA
content: Jrue Holiday doesn't rack up a ton of steals or blocks, but there is no player more important to the Celtics' stingy defense -- or their hopes to beat the Knicks and repeat as champions.

title: Clutch heroics, chess moves and plenty of luck: How the NBA's final 8 win it all
content: Eight teams remain in the race to the 2025 title. Zach Kram maps the championship path for each contender.

title: PSG oust Arsenal in semis, set up final with Inter
content: Paris Saint-Germain weathered an early Arsenal storm before goals by Fabian Ruiz and Achraf Hakimi sealed a 2-1 victory to send them into the Champions League final on Wednesday.

title: Curry to miss at least a week as Warriors 'adapt'
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry will miss at least one week of the playoffs after he was diagnosed with a Grade 1 left hamstring strain.

title: Finch asks NBA to review Dubs' 'shots at' Gobert
content: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch said his team submitted clips to the league office that showed what he believes was egregious contact made against center Rudy Gobert in Minnesota's 99-88 Game 1 loss.

title: Suit accuses ex-Laker Scott of '87 sexual assault
content: A woman is suing former Lakers player and coach Byron Scott, accusing him of sexually assaulting her in 1987, when he was 26 and she was 15.

title: Tusks up: Utah unveils Mammoth name, logo
content: After a 13-month process that included trademark drama and more than 850,000 ballots cast by fans in multiple rounds of voting, Utah Mammoth was revealed as the new name for the NHL franchise.

title: Police seize Maradona's medical records in raid
content: Police carried out an overnight raid at a Buenos Aires health clinic to seize Diego Maradona's complete medical records following a court order during the trial of seven health care professionals accused of negligence in the former soccer star's death.

title: Cowboys reach trade for Steelers WR Pickens
content: The Cowboys and Steelers have agreed to a trade that will send George Pickens to Dallas, where he will team up with CeeDee Lamb at wide receiver.

title: Ex-Utah QB Rising medically retires due to injury
content: Former Utah quarterback Cameron Rising announced Wednesday on social media that he's retiring from football because of an injury to his throwing hand.

title: üì∑Inside Saquon Barkley's night at the Met Gala
content: On fashion's biggest night, ESPN goes behind the scenes with the Super Bowl champion and Philadelphia Eagles star.

title: We graded both sides of the George Pickens trade: How the Cowboys, Steelers fared in the WR move
content: Pickens is headed to Dallas for draft picks. Did the Cowboys solve their WR2 problem -- and did the Steelers create one? Let's size up the move.

title: Are the Orioles blowing their contention window? What we can learn from other stacked young teams

content: It might sting Kevin de Bruyne and his fans that his time at Man City is coming to an end this summer, but it's the right call for both club and player.

content: Inter's 7-6 aggregate defeat of Bar√ßa will go down as one of the Champions League's best-ever set of games.

title: Trump: World Cup 'incentive' for Russia to end war
content: President Donald Trump has said that being able to compete at football's 2026 World Cup could be an "incentive" for Russia to end the war with Ukraine.

title: Spurs' Maddison out for season with knee injury
content: Tottenham midfielder James Maddison will miss the rest of the season with a knee injury, manager Ange Postecoglou has confirmed.

title: Arteta aims dig at Liverpool ahead of PSG semi
content: Mikel Arteta has said he hopes Arsenal will be in the "right place in the right moment" in Paris as they look to secure a place in the Champions League final.

title: Pedri: UEFA should 'look into' Bar√ßa-Inter ref
content: Barcelona midfielder Pedri has urged UEFA to investigate the refereeing performance in Tuesday's harrowing 4-3 Champions League semifinal defeat to Inter Milan at San Siro.

title: Garnacho 'happy' at United despite transfer links
content: Alejandro Garnacho has said he's "happy" at Manchester United despite continued speculation about his future.

content: Enzo Maresca has said lifting the Conference League this season would signify that "Chelsea are back."

content: Andr√© Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for fantasy women's basketball drafts including his ideal selections in each round.

content: Friends, colleagues, players and confidantes all agree: Popovich has impacted more people across the game than perhaps anyone in history.

title: Everything to know about Monday's NBA draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: Draft experts Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo break down the odds, likely picks and best fits for prospects.

title: Betting buzz: Curry injury shifts Warriors-Timberwolves Game 2 line five points
content: As oddsmakers continue to monitor Stephen Curry's hamstring strain, the Warriors' odds to win Game 2 against the Timberwolves have moved dramatically.

title: An inside look at the day boxing took over New York's Times Square
content: How one of the most iconic places in New York City transformed from a tourist area to a boxing venue.

content: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a look at some players who have started slowly that he expects to turn things around quickly.

title: Stock watch: Shelby Miller for saves?
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped and more.

content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final Cl√°sico, how could his last few weeks play out? And what's next for him and Real Madrid?

title: Bellingham ruled last season's Cl√°sicos. Can he save Madrid's title hopes vs. Bar√ßa?
content: It's been a challenging season for Jude Bellingham, but the title-deciding Cl√°sico is the perfect stage for him.

title: Doohan out, Colapinto in: Instability impedes Alpine ambition
content: Alpine has swapped drivers and lost a team principal this week, instability that will keep it down F1's order.

title: Terror will be tracked and punished, says J&K L-G
content: L-G Manoj Sinha lauds armed forces‚Äô precision strikes; reviews security, directs relocation of civilians from vulnerable areas

title: Kashmir calm, but fear is palpable among the locals
content: We pray the situation does not spiral out of hand, it‚Äôs Kashmir that always pays the cost of a war, let sanity prevail and peace follow, said a local

title: Sambhal court issues notice to Rahul Gandhi for remarks on RSS, BJP
content: On January 15, Mr. Gandhi alleged that the BJP and the RSS had ‚Äòcaptured every institution of the country,‚Äô adding, ‚ÄòWe are now fighting the BJP, the RSS, and the Indian state itself.‚Äô

title: Assigning BBMP responsibility to BMRCL MD draws criticism
content: Activists say this move, especially at a time when BBMP is undergoing a major governance overhaul and BMRCL is grappling with setbacks on its Yellow Line, could hamper the city‚Äôs critical infrastructure development

title: Operation Sindoor: Loitering munitions used against terror bases developed in Bengaluru
content: Loitering munitions, which are also known as suicide or Kamikaze drones, are developed by a Bengaluru-based private company which has a joint venture with an Israel-based military technology company

title: Construction of bypass to reduce traffic congestion in Tirupattur town begins
content: The four-lane stretch, to come up on the Tirupattur-Singarapettai High Road, will be an alternative route for long-distance travellers to go to places such as Dharmapuri, Salem, and Tiruvannamalai

title: Operation Sindoor: Pakistan authorises armed forces to take ‚Äòaction‚Äô after strike
content: In an emotional address to the nation Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif vowed to ‚Äúavenge every drop of blood‚Äù for dozens of Pakistanis believed to have been killed in the attacks by India

title: One dead, nine injured after aircraft crash in Punjab village
content: Crash site in Bathinda district cordoned off; authorities yet to confirm details of unidentified aircraft

title: Supreme Court asks why permanent mechanism cannot be put in place to conduct CLAT like NEET
content: The apex court pointed to ‚Äúcasual manner‚Äù in framing CLAT 2025 questions, issued notice to Education Ministry, and recalled its 2018 judgment flagging persistent organisational flaws in the exam.

title: Election Commission tells Supreme Court it will not erase data from EVMs slotted for verification
content: A Bench of Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna and Dipankar Datta was hearing a plea which had contended that the SOP framed by the poll body was not in tune with the April 2024 judgment of the apex court in the EVM-VVPAT case

title: Operation Sindoor: Govt calls all-party meet; Cabinet lauds military strikes
content: According to sources, the Prime Minister lauded the ‚Äòperfect‚Äô operations carried out by the armed forces; Congress hopes that Mr. Modi will attend the all-party meet after having skipped the earlier meeting in the aftermath of Pahalgam terror attack

title: Cabinet allocate more funds to five IITs, new scheme for ITIs
content: Cabinet clears ‚Çπ11,828 crore for expanding the IITs; greenlights ‚Çπ60,000 crore ITI upgrade scheme to skill 20 lakh youth

title: NIA asks tourists, locals to share info related to Pahalgam terror attack
content: The National Investigation Agency urges public cooperation in probe; appeals for photos, videos, and eyewitness accounts of Pahalgam attack

title: India briefs envoys of 13 Security Council members
content: Briefing of 13 envoys from the UNSC as part of a larger strategy to counter Pakistan at UNSC, 1267 terror listing and FATF

title: South CMs, victims‚Äô families hail ‚ÄòOperation Sindoor‚Äô as measured response to Pakistan
content: Chief Ministers, Opposition leaders express solidarity with armed forces; families of April 22 victims call strikes ‚Äòbefitting‚Äô

title: Political leaders across Uttar Pradesh hail armed forces for Operation Sindoor
content: Cross-party support for Army‚Äôs counter-terror strike; CM Adityanath, Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav laud response to Pahalgam attack

title: More firms from Tamil Nadu foray into warehousing space
content: Increasing demand for storage and logistics space is encouraging more businesses to venture into this sector

title: Operation Sindoor: Qatar, Spain and other global powers call for de-escalation
content: Qatari PM and Foreign Affairs Minister Al-Thani calls External Affairs Minister Jaishankar and his Pakistan counterpart; other leaders too hold telephonic conversations

title: Amar Mitra‚Äôs memories of war and resistance
content: From the blacked-out streets of 1965 Calcutta to the tense borderlands of 1971, eminent writer Amar Mitra recounts acts of quiet defiance and solidarity as Kolkata revisits echoes of war

title: Official panel‚Äôs first round of talks with employees‚Äô unions inconclusive¬†¬†
content: Revenue Secretary assures to take up demands with financial implications with the Chief Minister in a week

title: ASHA workers‚Äô protest draws wide support in Kannur
content: The march, which began in Kasaragod on May 5, 2025, is organised by the Kerala ASHA Health Workers Association to press its long-standing demands for better pay and working conditions

title: ‚ÄòWe stand united against terror‚Äô: Mamata backs Centre after Operation Sindoor
content: West Bengal CM calls for national unity in aftermath of ‚ÄòOperation Sindoor‚Äô; urges calm, announces precautionary measures in schools

title: ‚ÄòOperation Abhyaas‚Äô puts Hyderabad‚Äôs emergency response to test
content: The city‚Äôs biggest civil defence mock drill got underway to test the preparedness for large scale emergencies

title: Religion status would have benefited all Lingayat sub-castes, says M.B. Patl
content: The movement for religion status was wrongly projected by some as a ploy to divide the community, according to him

title: 21 airports in northern parts of India shut until May 10
content: These airports will remain closed till 5.29 a.m. on May 10; the airports span the Union Territories of Jammu and Kashmir as well as Leh, and States of Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Gujarat

title: MGS remembered by colleagues and students
content: The event organised by the MGS History Foundation saw the participation of several noted personalities, including former Calicut University Vice-Chancellor K.K.N. Kurup, historian M.R. Raghava Warrier, and literary critic M.M. Basheer

title: Post strike, India on high alert on land, air and sea
content: In anticipation of potential retaliation from Pakistan, India has fortified its defense systems across land, air, and sea. The air defense network is activated, warships are deployed, and frontline units are prepared. Strategic Forces Command is on high alert, with new weapon systems integrated since Balakot, enhancing India's readiness to respond to any misadventure.

title: Message to world: Strikes were in line with UNSC call to punish terrorists
content: India conducted military strikes, Operation Sindoor, targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan, citing the Pahalgam attack as a catalyst. Foreign Secretary Misri emphasized the strikes were non-escalatory and proportionate, linking the TRF to Lashkar-e-Taiba and Pakistan. India aims to deter further cross-border attacks and dismantle terror networks, highlighting Pakistan's failure to act against its own terrorist infrastructure and its history of misleading the international community on terrorism.

title: Blackouts, drills at airports: How India-wide civil defence exercise unfolded
content: India conducted a nationwide civil defence exercise named 'Operation Abhyaas'. The exercise simulated various emergency scenarios across multiple states and union territories. Drills included air raids, fire emergencies, and rescue missions. Delhi experienced sirens, evacuations, and a brief blackout. Other states like Punjab, Maharashtra, and Tamil Nadu also conducted similar exercises.

title: Strikes steel PM Modi's iron man credentials
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Prime Minister Modi authorized Operation Sindoor, defying international calls for restraint and skepticism about India's response. The precision strikes, showcasing advanced weaponry, countered Pakistan's nuclear threats and reaffirmed Modi's strong stance on national security. This decisive action silenced critics and bolstered public confidence, signaling a higher risk appetite for future security challenges and reinforcing the BJP's dominance in security matters.

title: Wednesday morning turns back clock in Uri to 1998 as heavy shelling begins
content: Tensions flared in Uri after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, stirring memories of past escalations and the 2016 surgical strikes. Despite a period of relative peace since 2003, residents prepared for the worst, cleaning bunkers and fearing renewed violence. Overnight precision strikes triggered massive Pakistani shelling, forcing evacuations and disrupting daily life, leaving the community in uncertainty as they sought shelter.

title: France President says US is committing error by withdrawing researchers‚Äô visas
content: European leaders are actively courting American researchers with substantial financial incentives, viewing U.S. cuts to research funding as a critical mistake. France and the European Commission have pledged significant investments, totaling hundreds of millions of dollars, to attract talent and bolster their own research programs.

title: 27 airports shut; over 400 flights cancelled today
content: Following heightened tensions, twenty-seven airports across north, west, and central India were temporarily closed, leading to the cancellation of 430 Indian flights on Thursday. Pakistan also experienced significant flight disruptions, with 147 cancellations. Airspace over Pakistan and western India saw a complete absence of civilian air traffic as airlines rerouted flights, primarily impacting international routes.

title: 10 of Parliament, Pulwama strike mastermind's family killed
content: Maulana Masood Azhar confirmed the death of ten family members in an Indian attack on Markaz Subhan Allah, a JeM seminary in Bahawalpur. Azhar expressed a desire to have joined them, while JeM identified his sister, her husband, and other relatives among the deceased. The UN-sanctioned terrorist, linked to numerous attacks in India, operates with ISI backing from the facility.

title: Operation Sindoor: Biochemist who left PhD for the uniform
content: Vadodara celebrated Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, a third-generation military officer, as she addressed the nation on Operation Sindoor, India's response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Hailing from a family with a strong tradition of service, Col Qureshi's dedication to the nation is deeply rooted. Her accomplishments include commanding an Army contingent in a multinational military exercise and serving with UN peacekeeping forces.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‚ÄòElon Musk‚Äô on Twitter; changes his profile name to‚Ä¶
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Operation Sindoor: A girl who grew up to 'own the skies'
content: Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, a Lucknow native and seasoned helicopter pilot, represented India's "Nari Shakti" at a press briefing detailing Operation Sindoor, the nation's airstrike response to the Pahalgam terror attack. Commissioned in 2004, she quickly rose through the ranks, specializing in Chetak and Cheetah helicopters with over 2,500 flying hours.

title: Families start evacuating women, kids & elderly from villages bordering Pak
content: Following escalating Indo-Pak tensions, border states Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat are experiencing significant disruptions. Mass displacement is occurring in Punjab's Ferozepur district, leading to school closures and panic buying in cities like Amritsar. Rajasthan's border districts are on high alert with increased patrolling and activated air defense systems, while Gujarat sees intensified marine and paramilitary patrols along its coastal areas.

title: IAF declines to comment on crash reports
content: An unidentified aircraft crashed near Aklian Kalan village in Bathinda, Punjab, resulting in the death of a civilian and injuries to ten others who approached the wreckage site. The incident occurred around 1:30 am, prompting a response from authorities who collected debris from the area, located approximately 20km from Bhisiana airbase. The IAF has not yet commented on the incident.

title: Amazon is changing its salary structure, here's who new guidelines favour
content: Amazon is revamping its compensation strategy, rewarding veteran top performers with up to 110% of their pay range for consistent excellence over four years. First-time high achievers and those with fluctuating performance will see reduced payouts.

title: Mysuru gears up for emergency preparedness
content: The district administration has constituted 12 specialised service teams comprising officials from various departments for effective response in the event of any emergency

title: Godavari riverfront development plan works commence in Rajamahendravaram City
content: The riverfront development plan includes development of 22 parks and infrastructure facilities for the Godavari Pushkarams-2027

title: Operation Sindoor receives backing across party lines in Maharashtra
content: Families of Pahalgam attack victims say precision strikes bring ‚Äúpeace‚Äù, as leaders across parties commend military response

title: Operation Sindoor: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu reviews civil defence preparedness
content: Calling for implementation of the Union government‚Äôs recommendations, he stresses the need for all departments to work in tandem and creating awareness among people

title: Thrissur Pooram concludes with ‚ÄòUpacharam Cholli Piriyal‚Äô ritual¬†
content: The final day featured ‚ÄòPakal Pooram,‚Äô also known as ‚ÄòThattakathe Pooram,‚Äô a festival within the festival, especially cherished by the local community

title: US, Canada issue travel advisories for India
content: Following the launch of Operation Sindoor, several foreign nations issued travel advisories for India. Canada cautioned its citizens about potential flight disruptions and escalating tensions, advising them to stay informed and follow local authority instructions. The United States also warned its citizens against travel to Jammu & Kashmir, citing potential flight disruptions across India.

title: Bengaluru-made ‚Äòsuicide drones‚Äô make debut with Operation Sindoor
content: Operation Sindoor utilized SkyStriker suicide drones, manufactured in Bengaluru through a joint venture between Alpha Design and Israel's Elbit Security Systems. These loitering munitions, procured by the Indian Army in 2021, feature a 100km range and carry a 5-10kg warhead. Their silent operation and precision strike capabilities offer a significant advantage in modern warfare, enhancing situational awareness for troops.

title: India‚Äôs space vision aims for global good, says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi, addressing the GLEX 2025, emphasized India's collaborative approach to space exploration, envisioning a future where its astronauts leave lunar footprints by 2040. He highlighted the upcoming Gaganyaan mission and an Indian astronaut's imminent journey to the International Space Station.

title: Ax-4 mission, with Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, may get delayed
content: The Axiom-4 mission, with India's Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla as pilot, faces a possible delay due to a minor technical issue, though the launch is still targeted for May 29. Isro chairman V Narayanan expressed confidence in the SpaceX launch vehicle and spacecraft for the mission to the ISS. Shukla will conduct seven experiments, fostering microgravity research in India during the 14-day stay.

title: Op Sindoor: How India carried out precision strikes in Pakistan, PoK
content: In a retaliatory move for the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor," executing precision strikes on nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Can't change EVM symbol loading unit for mock vote: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has enhanced EVM integrity checks by ruling that the symbol loading unit must remain unchanged during candidate-requested mock polls. This order came with the acceptance of the Election Commission's amended technical SOP, which includes self-diagnosis and mutual authentication. Engineers will also certify the software and memory of EVMs to ensure they haven't been tampered with.

title: Pak PM claims shooting 5 Indian jets, but provides no proof
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Pakistan's PM Sharif asserted in Parliament that its army swiftly retaliated against Indian strikes, claiming to have downed five Indian jets, though without providing evidence. Pakistan reports casualties in PoK and Punjab, alleging attacks on civilian areas, including a mosque. The NSC condemned India's actions as 'acts of war,' vowing a response and reserving the right to self-defense, while briefing China on the situation.

title: MS Dhoni discloses future plans after CSK end losing streak vs KKR
content: Following Chennai Super Kings' victory over Kolkata Knight Riders, captain MS Dhoni addressed his IPL future, stating he'll decide after assessing his body's ability to handle the game's demands over the next 6-8 months. Acknowledging fan support, Dhoni, 42, recognises he's in the final phase of his career.

title: PMLA accused entitled to list of all material collected by ED: SC
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that individuals accused under the anti-money laundering law are entitled to receive a comprehensive list of all documents and materials collected by the Enforcement Directorate during the investigation, including those not directly relied upon in the complaint. This decision aims to ensure a fair trial by allowing the accused access to potentially exculpatory evidence, reinforcing their right to defend themselves effectively.

title: Cancer survivor tops Chhattisgarh Class X boards with 99.2 per cent
content: Ishika Bala, a class 10 student from the Maoist-affected Kanker district, triumphed over blood cancer and emerged as the state board exam topper with an impressive 99.2%. Her success story shines as a beacon of hope in a region with low female literacy. Akhil Sen, the class 12 commerce topper, also hails from Kanker, highlighting the district's academic excellence.

title: High-flying gang of Char Dham thieves busted at Badrinath shrine
content: The "Pushpa Gang," an organized group of pickpockets from Andhra Pradesh, was apprehended at Badrinath shrine for targeting Char Dham pilgrims. The gang, led by Krishna Chhedoja, flew to Uttarakhand and other pilgrimage sites, exploiting crowds to steal valuables. Police recovered cash, mobile phones, and ATM cards after intensified surveillance following numerous theft complaints from devotees.

title: After India's intervention, Sotheby's puts off relics auction
content: Following Indian government intervention, Sotheby's Hong Kong has postponed the auction of the Piprahwa Buddhist Relics. The culture ministry, along with the Archaeological Survey of India and the Ministry of External Affairs, will engage stakeholders to discuss the relics' repatriation to India. A delegation emphasized the relics' sacred significance and rightful ownership by India, leading to the auction's postponement.

title: UK government says Pakistan needs to do more to tackle terror threat
content: The UK government urges Pakistan to intensify efforts against terrorism within its borders, emphasizing the threat it poses to regional stability and its own citizens. British ministers call for de-escalation and dialogue between India and Pakistan amidst rising tensions, offering support for mediation. Concerns are raised about the impact on British nationals and diaspora communities, with some MPs advocating for UNSC involvement.

title: Five school children among 6 killed in Patiala accident
content: A devastating head-on collision between an SUV and a sand-laden truck on Patiala-Samana road claimed six lives, including five schoolchildren aged between seven and twelve. The accident occurred near Nassupur village, leaving seven others injured. The impact was so severe that the SUV was mangled, requiring a JCB to retrieve the bodies.

title: 1,000 equines on Kedarnath route in quarantine after ‚Äòvirus outbreak‚Äô
content: A flu-like outbreak has led to the quarantine of over 1,000 mules and horses, suspending equine services on the Kedarnath yatra route for a third day. Following the deaths of 15 animals and detection of equine influenza symptoms, authorities have isolated affected animals and initiated widespread screening and treatment.

title: UK PIOs back military strike but there are no tensions with British Pakistani neighbours
content: Despite fears of escalating tensions in Britain following India's military strike, calm prevails as the Indian and Pakistani diaspora maintain amicable relations. Community leaders emphasize that their conflict lies with terrorism, not with any specific community or nationality. While expressing concern for families in the region, British Pakistanis foresee no spillover of tensions onto UK streets, highlighting their shared history and camaraderie.

title: "If I Can Do Anything To Help...": Trump On India-Pak Tensions
content: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, US President Donald Trump said if he could do anything to help, "I will be there" and wants the escalating conflict between the two countries to "stop".

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: Complete Blackout Enforced In Jaisalmer Between Midnight And 4 AM
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces early Wednesday carried out 24 precision missile strikes on nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK), including Muridke and Bahawalpur.

title: PM Modi To Reschedule 3-Nation Europe Visit As Tensions With Pakistan Soar
content: PM Modi has put his 3-nation Europe visit on hold as tensions between India and Pakistan have surged in the wake of the terror attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam in which 26 civilians were killed by Pak-linked terrorists in a religiously-motivated attack.

title: Black Smoke Signals No Pope Elected At First Conclave Vote
content: Black smoke appeared from a chimney atop the Sistine Chapel at the Vatican on Wednesday, signalling that the 133 Catholic cardinals meeting in a secret conclave failed to elect a new pope on their first ballot.

title: "If Pak Makes Mistake Of Escalation...": Shashi Tharoor On 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Welcoming the precise, coordinated attacks on terror sites in Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said at least three countries have expressed understanding of India's right to defend itself against terrorism.

title: Delhi Observes 15-Minute Power Blackout In Emergency Preparedness Drill
content: In an unprecedented sight on Wednesday evening, a 15-minute power blackout was observed in many areas of the national capital, including entire Lutyens' Delhi.

title: 6 Students, Driver Killed After SUV Collides With Truck In Punjab: Police
content: Six school children and a driver were killed when the SUV they were travelling in collided with a truck at Samana in Punjab's Patiala district on Wednesday, police said.

title: "Top Choice...": Russia Adds 2,000 Medical Seats For Indian Students
content: Nearly 2,000 additional seats have been added to accommodate the growing number of students keen on pursuing medical courses in Russian universities.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink Moves Closer To Approval, Gets 'Letter Of Intent': Report
content: Taking a step towards granting approval to Starlink, the government has issued a letter of intent to the Elon Musk-owned satellite internet services provider, according to a report by news agency PTI.

title: Iran's Foreign Minister To Meet S Jaishankar As India-Pak Tensions Surge
content: Iran's foreign minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi will begin his maiden visit to New Delhi tonight. On Thursday, he will meet his counterpart S Jaishankar, and together, they shall co-chair the 20th Joint Commission meeting between India and Iran.

title: "Nation Comes First": Groom Halts  Baraat   To Join Security Drill In Bihar
content: The wedding day is a significant event in an individual's life but for a man in Bihar, participating in the mega nationwide security drill that was carried out in view of "new and complex threats" after the Pahalgam terror attack was a bigger moment.

title: "Provoking Communal Discord": Centre Lists Aims Of Pahalgam Attack
content: The heinous terror attack in Pahalgam on inocent tourists was conducted not only to shred the peace in Jammu and Kashmir and destroy its tourism-based economy but also with the bigger motive of unleashing communal riots in the country.

title: The 9 Terror Targets In Pak Hit By India And Their Key Details
content: India carried out 24 precision cruise missile strikes at nine locations in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK) today in response to the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam last month, which killed 26 tourists.

title: Delhi Cabinet Approves Cloud-Seeding Trial Proposal To Tackle Air Pollution
content: The Delhi Cabinet on Wednesday approved a proposal to conduct five cloud-seeding trials to be overseen by IIT-Kanpur.

title: "Barrage Of Lies": Sources On Claims By Pak Side On 'Operation Sindoor'
content: In the wake of several misleading claims by the Pakistani side following India's precision strikes on nine locations in the country, sources have dubbed the campaign a "disinformation offensive" by the neighbouring country.

title: 'No Regret, No Despair': 10 Of Masood Azhar's Family Killed In Op Sindoor
content: Jaish-e-Mohammad chief Maulana Masood Azhar has claimed that 10 members of his family and four of his aides were killed in India's targeted airstrikes under Operation Sindoor to avenge the Pahalgam terror attack, news agency PTI reported.

title: Amit Shah asks border States to stock up on essential goods
content: Mock drills conducted across the country; Home Minister holds meeting with the Chief Ministers of border States

title: Overwhelming support to Operation Sindoor
content: Several politicians, various organisations and ex-servicemen have welcomed the army strike on terrorist hideouts in POK and Pakistan

title: Labour unions are worried as key changes are proposed in Factories Act
content: A meeting has been called on Thursday between labour unions and the Department of Factories, Boilers and Safety to discuss the proposals

title: Eluru collector orders district-wide civil mock drills
content: Eluru Collector said: ‚ÄúThe mock drill report must be documented with photographic evidence and submitted to the District Collectorate following each drill.‚Äù

title: Forensic evidence key to solving crimes, says Chittoor SP
content: Manikanta Chandolu calls on officers to strictly adhere to the legal procedures and avoid tampering with the crime scenes or wrongly handling the evidence and clues

title: Raichur Railway Station hosts exercise to check civil defence preparedness
content: A dedicated team of 32 members from the Civil Defence Organisation of South Central Railway and others participate in it

title: Rs 11,828cr expansion of 5 IITs to add 6.5k seats gets nod
content: The Union cabinet has approved a significant expansion of academic and infrastructure capacity for five IITs in Tirupati, Bhilai, Jammu, Dharwad, and Palakkad. This expansion, costing Rs 11,828.7 crore, aims to facilitate education for over 6,500 additional students and nearly double the current capacity to 13,687. The initiative includes creating 130 new faculty positions and establishing five state-of-the-art research parks to enhance industry-academia collaboration.

title: 26% dip in first week‚Äôs Char Dham footfall compared to 2024
content: The Char Dham yatra has experienced a 26% decrease in pilgrim footfall compared to last year, with 2.9 lakh devotees visiting the shrines. Officials attribute this decline to improved planning and staggered registration, implemented to prevent overcrowding. Despite the slower start due to the staggered opening schedule, the yatra is expected to gain momentum later in May, with over 25 lakh people already registered.

title: Pakistan shelling kills 12, prompts evacuation in J&K border districts
content: Following India's Operation Sindoor, Pakistan initiated heavy artillery and mortar fire along the LoC in J&K, resulting in a tragic loss of civilian lives, including children, and numerous injuries. The intense shelling, impacting areas like Poonch and Rajouri, prompted evacuations and shelter activations. Authorities are providing relief and medical assistance while addressing the escalating cross-border tensions.

title: Fed holds rates steady at 4.25‚Äì4.5% in Powell-led meet
content: The Federal Reserve, under Jerome Powell, held steady the benchmark interest rate, amidst concerns about balancing maximum employment and controlling inflation near the 2% target. The Fed will closely monitor incoming data and evolving outlook while reducing its holdings of Treasury securities.

title: Cat having poor heart rate gets pacemaker, a 'first for country'
content: Pillu, a seven-year-old cat in Pune, underwent a groundbreaking surgery to receive a pacemaker due to a dangerously low heart rate of 50 bpm. The procedure, performed by veterinary and human medical experts, addressed a complete heart block caused by myocarditis. Pillu is now recovering well, marking a significant advancement in Indian veterinary cardiology.

title: Woman‚Äôs death: Road accident turns out to be murder, two held
content: Karukachal police arrested Anshad Kabir and Ujaz Abdul Salam, both natives of Kanjirappally, in connection with the death of Neethu Krishnan. The investigation revealed that Krishnan's death, initially reported as a traffic accident near Karukachal, was actually a murder. Police determined that the suspects were acquainted with the victim and aware of the crime; the investigation is ongoing to determine the motive.

title: Op Sindoor vs Balakot: India raises the stakes with deep strikes in Pakistan
content: Indian armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, targeting terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. This action avenged the Pahalgam terror attack. Strikes hit JeM and LeT headquarters, plus Hizbul Mujahideen sites. India used precision munitions and loitering drones. The operation aimed to dismantle terror infrastructure. It signifies a major escalation beyond previous cross-border actions.

title: Army videos show how India destroyed Pakistan terror camps
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, the Indian Army launched "Operation Sindoor," targeting nine terrorist locations in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. The strikes, executed with precision, aimed at dismantling critical infrastructure belonging to terror groups like LeT, JeM, and Hizbul Mujahideen.

title: Noor Ahmad and Dewald Brevis star in CSK's two-wicket win vs KKR
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by two wickets in a thrilling match, jeopardizing KKR's playoff chances and ending CSK's four-match losing streak. Dewald Brevis's explosive innings of 52 off 25 balls shifted the momentum after an early CSK collapse.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after KKR vs CSK match
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders in a thrilling match. This victory significantly impacts the playoff race. Kolkata Knight Riders' chances for the top four are now uncertain. Chennai Super Kings, though out of contention, displayed a strong performance. The points table sees Gujarat Titans leading, with other teams closely competing for playoff spots.

title: 'Brilliant name': Tharoor applauds symbolism behind 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Following a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, India launched 'Operation Sindoor,' a retaliatory strike destroying nine terrorist infrastructure sites in Pakistan and PoK. Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor lauded the operation and praised its codename's emotional resonance and the armed forces' decisive action. "Clever, especially given the government‚Äôs penchant for creative acronyms! But jokes apart, #OperationSindoor is a brilliant name," Tharoor said in a post on X.

title: Starlink gets crucial nod for satcom services in India
content: Starlink has received a Letter of Intent from the Indian government for its satellite communication services, signaling progress in its pursuit of an Indian satcom license.

title: Ravindra Jadeja surpasses KKR's mentor, becomes CSK's leading wicket-taker
content: Ravindra Jadeja etched his name in Chennai Super Kings' history, surpassing Dwayne Bravo as the leading IPL wicket-taker with 141 wickets. Kolkata Knight Riders, after winning the toss, posted 179-6, powered by Ajinkya Rahane's impactful innings of 48 and Andre Russell's cameo of 38.

title: Cardinals Enter Sistine Chapel For Secret Conclave To Elect New Pope
content: Catholic cardinals who will choose the next pope filed into the Sistine Chapel on Wednesday, before locking themselves away from the world to elect the man they hope can unite a diverse but divided global Church.

title: Operation Sindoor "Befitting Reply" To Those Who Challenge India: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said "Operation Sindoor" demonstrates the Narendra Modi government's "zero-tolerance policy against terrorism to the entire world"

title: Netflix To Roll Out All-New Experience Across TV And Mobile Platforms
content: Netflix will soon change its user experience across TV, mobile, and tablet with an aim to maintain and expand its leadership position and market share globally.

title: Armed Forces Conducted Two-Pronged Attack On Pak Terror Bases During Operation Sindoor: Sources
content: Pakistan's terrorist bases were hit twice during the armed forces' post-midnight "Operation Sindoor" today, sources have said.

title: Valentina Shevchenko and Demetrious Johnson make GOAT case ... for each other
content: shevchenko has ruled the 125-pound division for a great majority of the division's eight-year existence . she will face manon Fiorot in this weekend's co-main event in Montreal . the 37-year-old has been matched with a new dance partner .

title: NBA playoff futures: Warriors odds dip following Curry injury news
content: the Cleveland Cavaliers have the third-best odds to win the finals . but they fell from 5-1 to 10-1 following Tuesday's loss to the Indiana Pacers . they are now the favorites in the series at -190 and move from 30-1 to 15-1 .

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players: Wilson is No. 1, but where do Collier, Stewart, Clark land?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is here, with preseason games underway and the regular season set to tip May 16 . a'ja Wilson and the Las Vegas Aces have a bit of a new look but remain confident in their core . caitlin Clark is looking to lead the Indiana Fever into title contention .

title: What Pickens trade means for Cowboys, Steelers -- and Aaron Rodgers
content: the move closes the books on pickens' three-year career in the Steel City . the move is a shattered post-NFL draft quiet . he's offered a new opportunity in the Dallas Cowboys .

title: Final NBA 2K25 Flash Pack brings Howard, Giannis, more to the court
content: 2K Games is getting ready to wind things down in the NBA 2K25 . the final Flash Pack drops on may 7 . more than 19 cards with 100 OVR and more than 55 cards with 99 OVR can be pulled .

title: As it happened: PSG dispatch Arsenal, advance to face Inter in Champions League final
content: We are down to the final four! It's the second day of the semifinal second legs of the 2024-25  UEFA Champions League  season. Enjoy the play-by-play from today's game:  Paris Saint-Germain  against  Arsenal , live from the Parc des Princes in Paris. Jump to:   UCL home page  |  Liveblog

title: How the kick change -- MLB's hottest new pitch -- has kick-started the Mets' rotation
content: the kick change is a changeup-splitter hybrid that has surged in popularity . megill is the odd man out of the Mets' rotation since debuting in 2021 . he has a few obvious things in common .
